column5: Nicely done Bill & Dave  Hopefully this weekend will be full of tanks like those
Good luck Mike! I'm stuck at home doing oncall...   Next weekend however is a different story!
ON CALL! Take the phone with you, probably a 7 minute run to shore change in the truck and off you go.
Dang thats a beast for sure congrats
Enormous fish...nice dark colourations too.  Fish of a lifetime for many
Nice fish Bill!  Thanks for posting.  Mark
awesome laker bill congrats
WHAT THE HELL IS IT?!!
Nice Bill Sure is a big laker!
Congrats Bill. That's a hog for sure!
Wow! If I caught 1  half that size I'd be happy!!
Great catch....  It's exciting when you push the limits if you ice hole....
Awesome lake trout bill !!!! Wow .... She is a tank!!!! ..... Glad ya got her up through the hole....tight-lines
Now that's a big dirty greaser!!  Is that picture cropped or were you fishing solo?  Either way, that's a beast.  Congrats!!
That was taken with a camera phone, no cropping.    I wish I had my DSLR with me.
That was taken with a camera phone, no cropping.    I wish I had my DSLR with me.  No Doubt!  Not a bad job for a selfie though!
Not "selfies".   I took the pictures quickly with my phone.
Not "selfies".   I took the pictures quickly with my phone. Too bad you couldn't enlarge it like I couldn't with my text sent picture.  lol.Just foolin ,Great fish guys!!!
I tried to best Bill's fish but only managed to connect with little ones.
I tried to best Bill's fish but only managed to connect with little ones.     pfft,that would fit through a 6" hole.LOL  Nice fish again byes.
I tried to best Bill's fish but only managed to connect with little ones.   Nice fish,you really need to move away from the little ones lol.  Good show!!!!
Wow way to go!!! Laker of a lifetime!!!!!
nice size buddy! good catch
wow beauty
WOW, beauty!!!!
Beautiful fish and great story!  Just a brute through the ice!!  I can't even imagine...
Wow Bill that's a beast , congrats     Glad to hear you let her go !
That one is a CRACKAH Bill.  Geez!  Can imagine some wicked reel peel through the hole.  Nothing much more enjoyable in icefishing than seeing the BIG bar appear, lay chase and hammertime.
What a tank!!  Congrats!
Wow huge fish I'm going to assume a PB. Congrats
Nice fish!
That what it's about!!!   Nice work!  Congrats!
Congrats bill!!  What a brute!  Just what you needed this year!
Nice fish Bill!!!   WTG
Nice tanker Bill!  Cheers, Ron...
Beautiful fish.
Now  'That's' a Lake Trout!!!  Beauty fish there Bill  Cheers Rick
Now  'That's' a Lake Trout!!!  Beauty fish there Bill  Cheers Rick x2  Amazing -- Congratulations William and Crew  All thru an 8 inch hole  Perfect  Cheers  Paul
Mmmmmmm. Breast.  Perdy fish Bill.
Wow what a greaser !!! that's a beast !  So will you tell us the story ?
Great fish!  Must have been a fun ride.  Let's hear the story.
Nice fish Bill!!!
Great fish!

So I sent my buddy Dave this txt the night before...     Go figure what happened the next day, lol!  I don't know why but I love lake trout.  I've spent more time on Nipigon trolling for that elusive 30-40lbr then my oldman cares to remember.  Don't ask me why, but there's just something about these fish that I love.   I think this was fish #3 or #4 of the day.  With the front moving in, we were hoping the system would cause them to go on a bit of a feeding frenzy, we were right..  But as soon as that storm showed up, the fishing died almost completely.  I was using a custom Loomis icerod made from a float blank (It's either GLX or IMX, Rick, you'll need to tell me!)  that a buddy was nice enough to give me or else I might have been in trouble.  Paired it up with a Saros 1000, 6lb Fireline Crystal and 6lb Drennan flouro for a lead.   I saw this massive mark come off bottom towards my bait, the mark was so thick I thought for a split second that there was something wrong with my finder.   Before I could barely start 'the chase'  she smashed it...   Screamed down to the bottom then went sideways, this big brute just didn't want to come up.    Multiple times I had to stick the rod in the hole to avoid the line being shredded by the ice..   I really don't know how long I fought the fish, maybe 20mins or so?   The first glimpse of it and we both almost crapped our pants, it looked like a shark below the hole with those massive fins sticking out to the side.   We knew it was big, but didn't think it was this big, lol!!    We both assumed she was a spawned out female, her fins looked like she's gone through many a spawning cycle..  We got her in, snapped a few pics and she was back in the water in no time.   Definitely a PB through the ice for me, and most likely my biggest lake trout ever.
OH man! That's a benchmark if I've ever seen one!  Congrats Bill, call this ice season a success
Great fish Bill!  25 fett under the ice
Wow - now that is a greaser!!! Love the dark colouration too. Congratulations!  Pete
What a whale! Nice one. She's actually pretty good looking for her age...
Thats one huge laker Bill. Grats.  Heard there was a 27 lb caught a week or so back. No pics,but the word is,it was released.
Thats one huge laker Bill. Grats.  Heard there was a 27 lb caught a week or so back. No pics,but the word is,it was released.  Heard the same over on the Simcoe board, that's a giant fish.
For sure  Theres got to be a 30 out there.
That's awesome, Bill. Well done!
Almost didn't fit.  Absolute behemoth!!!!!
WOW!Nice fish Bill!That one wouldn't fit in my smoker
wow great fish well done
damn
Atta boy Bill, that things a brute !!
That's nice Bill.What a fish!!
wow what a fish...
Wow that's big!
BEAST! I'm getting too lazy old to use an 8 inch manual auger for more than a dozen holes.  Edit for the Freudian slip. Hockey, fish and _______ on my mind I guess.
Who let you hold their fish???  GREAT stuff Bill... and supposing that's a Simcoe fish... eating well out there on all them herring! Did yah get measurements on that 35 pounder??
Not a Simcoe fish Wayne...which makes it even more impressive IMO.   Was 38 inches of angry Char.
Can't get much better than that!! Nice going!!  Apparently you could breast that one
BREAST! I'm getting too lazy old to use an 8 inch manual auger for more than a dozen holes.

Not a Simcoe fish Wayne...which makes it even more impressive IMO.   Was 38 inches of angry Char.  Yeah, definitely not 35lbs (I wish!)   Mid 20's would be a good guess.   Didn't get a girth measurement.
Looks bigger than a 38 in those shots! My avatar's a 38... guestimated it at about 23 lbs... and yours looks a lot fatter and a bigger head.
She was an old girl (I'm guessing she was female), fins were beat up from spawning...  Very thick, I can't imagine how big she was when she was full of spawn!
?Yah a big Breast!  well done.
Yep Breast.. the other white meat.
Very impressive Laker Bill, a great picture and a fat healthy tank, a great fight im sure
Great fish bill! Breast, just had to say it;)
Wow! Unreal fish bud!
Damn, that's a nice fish Bill!  Congrats!
There's a reason I don't use puny little 8" augers when I go out.
Beauty!!!
wow what a beast, but this is one of the reason I bought an 8" auger because you never know
